description: Borrowed from Latin pungens (stem pungent-), present participle of pungo (“to sting”). Doublet of poignant.

adjectives.description: pungent (comparative more pungent, superlative most pungent)

entries.meaning: Having a strong odor that stings the nose, said especially of acidic or spicy substances.
examples: I accidentally dropped the bottle of ammonia and after few seconds, a very pungent stench could be detected.

entries.meaning: Having a strong taste that stings the tongue, said especially of hot (spicy) food, which has a strong and sharp or bitter taste.

examples: The critic gave a pungent review.

entries.meaning: (botany) Having a sharp and stiff point.
